intro: Echites circinnalis, commonly known as the golden star cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped blooms that are often arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Echites circinnalis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand harsh desert conditions.
